title: PLD Runtime Event Envelope
description: A lightweight transport envelope for delivering PLD events with runtime context. The nested PLD event object remains the source of truth for lifecycle semantics.

envelope_id.description: Unique identifier for this envelope instance (UUIDv4 recommended). Represents a single transport instance, not the semantic event identity.

timestamp.description: Envelope creation timestamp (ISO 8601). May differ from event.timestamp.

version.description: Envelope schema version (distinct from PLD event schema_version).

session.description: Logical session metadata. Must align with the PLD event.

user_id.description: Optional user or external system identifier.

platform.description: Canonical platform type. Use `custom` when not listed.

platform_detail.description: Free-form detail such as internal system name, model version, etc.

trace.description: Optional trace metadata for debugging and observability. NOT authoritative for PLD lifecycle ordering.

trace_id.description: Logical identifier for related runtime steps or distributed trace.

turn_index.description: Debugging-only ordering helper. NOT authoritativeâ€”use event.turn_sequence for lifecycle ordering.

parent_trace_id.description: Optional parent identifier used for forks or conversation branches.

runtime.description: Runtime execution context. May contain experimental fields.

tags.description: Optional metadata used for grouping (tenant, region, experiment, shard, etc.).

event.x-note: Adjust the $ref path depending on your folder layout or replace with a URI registry reference.
event.description: Nested PLD event. MUST be validated using the PLD event specification.

session_id_consistency.description: Envelope MUST reference the same session as the contained event.
session_id_consistency.note: This is NOT automatically enforced by JSON Schema. Implementations MUST enforce this check in the ingestion/validation layer.
